Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Electrostimulation in Dysvascular Amputees

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either electrostimulation of the gastrocnemius muscle plus standard rehabilitation or standard rehabilitation alone.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either electrostimulation of the gastrocnemius muscle plus standard rehabilitation or standard rehabilitation alone.

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the effectiveness of non-surgical interventions in preventing CLL tissue loss and amputation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of new major amputation of the CLL over a 12-month period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was based on birthdate, with unclear allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding of outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians was not reported.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A randomised controlled trial was conducted involving 50 dysvascular amputees.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Electrostimulation was associated with a three-fold reduction in the incidence of new major amputation of the CLL (RR 0.33, 95% CI 0.04 to 2.99).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events, time to new tissue loss, time to and incidence of minor amputation, health-related quality of life outcomes, and hospital readmissions were not reported.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration: Protocol available via DOI 10.1002/14651858.CD013857

Funding.evidence: This study received no dedicated funding.
